subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] something else to add
author: Jody Cupp
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00FC_01C68FD2.70EB97F0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Amy,
It can be done, yes!! But you must be careful, that you know who you a=
re talking to, not someone pretending to be who you want to hear from.  I'v=
e also had people in spirit speak for them. It'll be "so and so says-blah b=
lah blah"   I have heard from family members (My dad, Grandma, Uncle Mike, =
and Great Grandma Sylvia). Just be careful because it's not all "I love you=
" from them lol.

Concentrate on who you want to speak to.  Say aloud your =
intention and the time you will be recording (its' like sending out an invi=
tation).  If they don't come the first time keep trying. 

If you meditate,=
 this is also a good time to meditate to get your energy up. I found if I m=
editate for even 10 min before I record that the messages are clearer.


  =
----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Amy Swanson 
  To: evp-itc@yahoogroup=
s.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 4:33 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] someth=
ing else to add



  I forgot to say that YOU are on a roll today huh? LOL
=
  the email boxes are full from us sending messeges ROFL

  heres a weird q=
uestion....................can you ask your "people" to find someone on the=
 other side? Like i want to hear from my dad and grandma...........can some=
thing like that be done?

  amy



  http://groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/=


  LON3_S7AR  YAHOO MESENGER ID
  ________________________________________=
__________
  Do You Yahoo!?
  Tired of spam? Yahoo! Mail has the best spam =
protection around 
  http://mail.yahoo.com
